page.title: 13THE FORESTS AND WILDLIFE.
page.content: The Forestry Commission are the predominant land owners with the earliest plantations in 1955. Three forms of land use can be seen over the last 200 years _Crofting, in the still identifiable township of Collaig,hill sheep farming and forestry which is mainly conifer but still with many of the oaks,ashes, rowans, hazels, alders etc. which covered the land before the advent of sheep. The area abounds with large mammals _the native red and roe deer together with the occasional sika and its hybrids with red deer. These are culled by the forest ranger who also stalks with clients on day permits,this providing extra revenue and sport. Foxes and badgers breed at Achachenna. The golden eagle hunts the high corner of the area and the osprey fishes the loch.
